workflow.name: Process Shopify new orders with Zoho CRM and Harvest
workflow.description:
This workflow is triggered when a new order is created in Shopify. Then:
- the order information is stored in Zoho CRM,
- an invoice is created in Harvest and stored in Trello,
- if the order value is above 50, an email with a discount coupon is sent to the customer and they are added to a MailChimp campaign for high-value customers; otherwise, only a "thank you" email is sent to the customer.

Note that you need to replace the *List ID* in the *Trello node* with your own ID (see [instructions in our docs](https://docs.n8n.io/nodes/n8n-nodes-base.trello/#example-usage)). Same goes for the *Account ID* in the *Harvest node* (see [instructions here](https://docs.n8n.io/credentials/harvest/#using-access-token)).

parameters.message:
=Hi {{$json["customer_firstname"]}},

Thank you for your order! Here's a 15% coupon code to use for your next order: COUPON15

Best,
Shop Owner
parameters.subject: Your Shopify order

parameters.message:
=Hi {{$node["Set fields"].json["customer_firstname"]}},
Thank you for your order! We're getting it ready for shipping it to you.

Best,
Shop Owner
parameters.subject: Your Shopify order

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
